question: What does the Imam say to the congregation right before he begins the Salah?
answer:
QUESTION

I would like to know what the Imam says in arabic to people when he is about to begin the Salah.

How is the phrase said in arabic (Istawooo...Aqeemoo) and is it compulsory to say it before you begin the congregational Salah?

ANSWER


Share:

In the Name of Allāh, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

As-salāmu ‘alaykum wa-rahmatullāhi wa-barakātuh.


There is a lot of emphasis placed on the straightening of the rows.[i] Those praying behind the Imam should be diligent in keeping the rows aligned throughout the Salah.

The term استووا means to “straighten and align [the rows].” The term أقيموا الصفوف means to “establish the rows” and to balance and make them equivalent.[ii]

Straightening the rows is achieved by aligning the heels and the ankles. [iii] [iv]

Closing the gaps is done by joining shoulder with shoulder.[v]

It is mustahabb (desirable) for the Imam to remind the congregation to straighten the rows as Rasulullah (salallahu alayhi wa sallam) used to do so. [vi]


And Allāh knows best.

Ml. Sohail Bengali
Chicago, IL (USA)

Concurred by:

Muftī Abrar Mirza
Chicago, IL (USA)

Under the Supervision of Muftī Ebrahim Desai (South Africa)

قوله ( استووا ) أي في الصف...قوله ( أقيموا الصفوف ) أي عدلوهها [ii]

فتاوى محمودية، كتاب الصلاة: ٧/ ٩٦ كتب خانة مظهري [iii]
